H0.text: What was developed at the Bell Telephone Company under the direction of Dr William Shockley. Semiconductor

H1.text: What was developed at the Bell Telephone Company under the direction of Dr William Shockley. Telephone Switching System

H2.text: What was developed at the Bell Telephone Company under the direction of Dr William Shockley. Solar Cell

H3.text: What was developed at the Bell Telephone Company under the direction of Dr William Shockley. Transistor

A4.text: The first working device was a point-contact transistor invented in 1947 by physicists John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and William Shockley at Bell Labs.

A5.text: The first bipolar junction transistors were invented by Bell Labs' William Shockley, who applied for patent (2,569,347) on June 26, 1948.
